extendedIngredients.name: active yeast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ¼ tsp (one ¼-oz package) active dry yeast

extendedIngredients.name: coconut oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ tbsp (7g) unsalted butter or coconut oil, melted

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Cranberry Sweet Rolls
recipes.instructions: Lightly coat a 9-round springform pan or cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.To prepare the filling, toss together the cranberries, sugar, and cornstarch in a medium bowl until thoroughly combined.To prepare the dough, stir together the milk, butter, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Sprinkle the yeast on top, and wait 10-15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy. Mix in 1  cups of flour. If the dough is still wet, continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl.Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface, and knead for 3-5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. Let the dough rest for 10 minutes.On a clean, well-floured surface, roll the dough out into a 14x10 rectangle. Spread the filling on top of the dough, leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. Carefully roll up the dough into a log, starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. Pinch the ends to seal. If the dough wont stick together, gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal.Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife. Place the rolls into the prepared pan, and cover the pan with a clean towel. Set the pan in a warm, draft-free spot, and let the rolls rise for 30-45 minutes or until doubled in size.Preheat the oven to 350F. Bake the cinnamon rolls for 18-22 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides feel firm. Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before serving.While the rolls cool, prepare the drizzle. Stir together the stevia and milk in a small bowl. Transfer the mixture to a zip-topped bag, snip off a small corner, and drizzle on top of the rolls just before serving.

steps.step: Lightly coat a 9-round springform pan or cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.To prepare the filling, toss together the cranberries, sugar, and cornstarch in a medium bowl until thoroughly combined.To prepare the dough, stir together the milk, butter, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Sprinkle the yeast on top, and wait 10-15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy.

Mix in 1  cups of flour. If the dough is still wet, continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl.Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface, and knead for 3-5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it.
Let the dough rest for 10 minutes.On a clean, well-floured surface, roll the dough out into a 14x10 rectangle.

Spread the filling on top of the dough, leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. Carefully roll up the dough into a log, starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. Pinch the ends to seal. If the dough wont stick together, gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal.Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife.

Place the rolls into the prepared pan, and cover the pan with a clean towel. Set the pan in a warm, draft-free spot, and let the rolls rise for 30-45 minutes or until doubled in size.Preheat the oven to 350F.

Bake the cinnamon rolls for 18-22 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides feel firm. Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before serving.While the rolls cool, prepare the drizzle. Stir together the stevia and milk in a small bowl.
Transfer the mixture to a zip-topped bag, snip off a small corner, and drizzle on top of the rolls just before serving.
